column1: Policy
1: Lower Individual Income Tax Rates Across the Board (Lower All Rates by 10%)
2: Lower the Top Marginal Income Tax Rate (25% Top Rate)
3: Consolidate Current Brackets into Three: 10 percent, 25 percent, and 35 percent
4: Reduce Employer- and Employee-Side Payroll Tax by 1 Percentage Point Split (1 Percentage Point Split)
5: Lower the Top Rate on Capital Gains and Dividends to 15 Percent
6: Index Capital Gains Realizations to Inflation
7: Make 100 Percent Bonus Depreciation Permanent
8: Implement Neutral Cost Recovery for Structures
9: Cancel the Amortization of Research and Development Expenses
10: Make Section 199A Deduction Permanent
11: Lower the Corporate Tax Rate (Lower to 15%)
12: Lower the Estate Tax Rate to 30 Percent
13: Repeal Tariffs Imposed Under Sections 232, 201, and 301
SUBTOTAL, ECONOMY
51: Double EITC for Workers without Qualifying Children to $1,075
52: Reform the EITC for Married and Unmarried Workers, with and without Children
53: Make Child Tax Credit Fully Refundable
54: Make Child Tax Credit First Dollar Refundable
55: Restructure the Child Tax Credit and Earned Income Tax Credit
56: Increase the Standard Deduction by 25% for All Filing Groups
57: Restore the Personal Exemption
58: Make Charitable Deduction "Above-the-Line"
S1: Free, universal pre-kindergarten for all three- and four-year olds
S2: Tuition-free two-year community college
S3: Increase Pell Grants for low-income students
S4: Increase funding for community colleges
S5: Two-years of subsidized tuition for students from families earning less than $125,000 enrolled in a four-year HBCU, TCU, or MSI
S6: Train, equip, and diversify American teachers
S7: Increase institutional aid grants to HBCUs, TCUs, and MSIs
S8: Make child care more affordable, invest in high-quality care, and fund training for child care providers
S9: Create a national comprehensive paid family and medical leave program
S10: Expand summer Electronic Benefits Transfer to all eligible children nationwide
S11: Expand free meals for children in the highest poverty districts
S12: Facilitate re-entry for formerly incarcerated individuals through Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (SNAP) eligibility
S13: Extend and make permanent the Child Tax Credit expansions from the American Rescue Plan and make the Child Tax Credit fully refundable
S14: Extend expanded ACA premiums & tax credits from the American Rescue Plan
S15: Make the American Rescue Plan (EITC) expansion for childless workers permanent
S16: Make permanent the temporary Child and Dependent Tax Credit (CDCTC) expansion in the American Rescue Plan
S17: Cancel student loan debt relief (Biden executive action)
S18: Establish mandatory paid national service for youth and young adults
SUBTOTAL, SOCIAL
Social Tax
Social Spending
NS1A: Double funds dedicated to Europe & NATO (including Ukraine)
NS1B: Increase by 50% funds dedicated to Europe & NATO (including Ukraine)
NS1C: Reduce by 50% runds dedicated to Europe & NATO (including Ukraine)
NS2A: Double funds dedicated to the Middle East (including Iran & Israel)
NS2B: Increase by 50% funds dedicated to the Middle East (including Iran & Israel)
NS2C: Reduce by 50% runds dedicated to the Middle East (including Iran & Israel)
NS3A: Double funds dedicated to the Indo-Pacific (including Taiwan)
NS3B: Increase by 50% funds dedicated to the Indo-Pacific (including Taiwan)
NS3C: Reduce by 50% runds dedicated to the Indo-Pacific (including Taiwan)
NS4A: Double funds dedicated to protecting the homeland
NS4B: Increase by 50% funds dedicated to protecting the homeland
NS4C: Reduce by 50% runds dedicated to protecting the homeland
NS5A: Double funds dedicated to advanced national security technology
NS5B: Increase by 50% funds dedicated to advanced national security technology
NS5C: Reduce by 50% runds dedicated to advanced national security technology
NS6A: Allocate $90B/year new funds dedicated to economic statecraft
NS6B: Allocate $45B / year new funds dedicated to economic statecraft
NS7A: Make significant incremental reforms to base defense spending
NS7B: Make major reforms to base defense spending
NS7C: Conduct fundamental restructuring of base defense spending
14: Raise Individual Income Tax Rates by 10 Percent
15: Repeal the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (TCJA) Individual Tax Changes
16: Revert to Pre-2018 Individual Income Tax Rates on Income Over $400,000
17: Add a New Bracket of 45 Percent for Income Above $750,000
18: Create an Additional Flat Individual Income Tax of 5%
19: Eliminate the Child Tax Credit
20: Reduce the Child Tax Credit to $500
21: Eliminate the Earned Income Tax Credit
22: Eliminate the Federal Income Tax Deduction for State and Local Taxes
23: Eliminate the Home Mortgage Interest Deduction
24: Lower the Home Mortgage Interest Deduction Cap to $500,000 in Principal
25: Eliminate the Charitable Deduction
26: Limit Tax Savings from Itemized Deductions to 28 Percent of Value
27: Eliminate the Tax Exclusion for Municipal Bond Interest
28: Tax Carried Interest as Ordinary Income
29: Raise the Top Capital Gains and Dividend Tax Rate to 30%
30: Raise Top Capital Gains Rate to 39.6 Percent on Income Above $1 Million
31: Eliminate the Exclusion of Capital Gains on Principal Residences
33: Increase Employer- and Employee-side Payroll Tax by 1 Percentage Point Split (1 Percentage Point Split)
34: Eliminate the Social Security Payroll Tax Cap
35: Apply the Social Security Payroll Tax to Wages Above $400,000
36: Raise the Corporate Income Tax (28% CIT Rate)
37: Institute a Corporate Surtax of 5 Percent
38: Eliminate the Section 199A Deduction
39: Require Amortization of Advertising Expenses over 10 Years
40: Return to Alternative Depreciation Schedule (ADS)
41: Repeal Last-in, First-out (LIFO) Inventory Accounting
42: Eliminate 1031 Like-Kind Exchanges
43: Enact a 5% Value Added Tax
44: Return the Estate Tax to Clinton-era Levels
45: Eliminate Step-Up in Basis on Capital Gains
46: Lower the Estate and Gift Tax Exemption Amount to $2 Million
47: Increase the Gas Tax by 15 Cents Per Gallon and Inflation Adjust Going Forward
48: Increase the Gas Tax by 35 Cents Per Gallon and Inflation Adjust Going Forward
49: Reinstate the Cadillac Tax
50: Institute a Carbon Tax ($25 per Ton)
51: Added cost if nuclear waste storage remains dispersed
SUBTOTAL, FISCAL/ENVIRONMENT
59: Tax Individual Incomes at a Flat 30% Rate (20% Flat Tax)
60: Eliminate the Individual Alternative Minimum Tax
61: Permanently Eliminate the Pease Limitation on Itemized Deductions
62: Make the 2017 Tax Law Standard Deduction, Personal Exemption, and CTC Permanent
63: Implement $2,500 per Year Roth-style Universal Savings Accounts
64: Eliminate the Net Investment Income Tax
65: Enact Full Expensing for All Capital Investment
66: Maintain Limitation on Interest Deductibility at 30 Percent of EBITDA
67: Eliminate Various Business Tax Expenditures
68: Replace the Corporate Income Tax with a 5 Percent Value-Added Tax (VAT)
69: Eliminate Estate and Gift Taxes
70: Increase Alcohol Excise Taxes to $16 per Proof Gallon and Index to Inflation
SUBTOTAL, ADMINISTRATIVE
TOTAL
